alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:04AM EST until February 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida affecting Clay County. North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Impacts...At 25.0 feet, HWY 541 near the Kentucky Mountain Bible is impassable. At 29.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. Water begins inundating Wolverine Road just north of the Hays Depot bridge. College is impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to around 28.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 17.6 feet early Saturday afternoon. It should then rise to 18.2 feet early Sunday morning, before receding. - Action stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
